poem:
Title: "New Year's Eve Requiem"

When red lights yield not to reckless haste,
Another page of life, erased.
Memory, the mourner in the crowd,
Weeps beneath winter's sky, shroud.
Two brave women in the urban blight,
Taken by the failing daylight.
A city's sorrow in a siren's scream,
San Francisco mourns on the night of gleam.
